    • Method Detail

      • peekInt

        public static int peekInt​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Reads an integer in the buffer at its current index and then decrement the index by 4

        This method will block until an integer could be read or an exception was thrown

        Parameters:
        buffer -
        Returns:
        the peeked integer
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferOverflowException - If there are fewer than 4 bytes remaining in this buffer

      • peekByte

        public static byte peekByte​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Read a byte in the buffer at its current index and then decrement the index by 1

        This method will block until an integer could be read or an exception was thrown

        Parameters:
        buffer -
        Returns:
        the peeked byte
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - If there are fewer than 1 byte remaining in this buffer

      • writeNetworkString

        public static void writeNetworkString​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                      java.lang.String string)
        Attempts to write a network formatted string to the given ByteBuffer
        Parameters:
        buffer - The bufer to write to
        string - The string to write

      • calculateNetworkStringLength

        public static int calculateNetworkStringLength​(java.lang.String string)
        Calculates how many bytes a string will take when sent over the network.

        Note : This takes into account the 4 bytes that encode the string length

        Parameters:
        string - The string
        Returns:
        The number of bytes

      • readNetworkString

        public static java.lang.String readNetworkString​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Attempts to read a network formated string from a ByteBuffer (cf. Documentation for network string formatting)

        This method will blocks until a string could be read, or an exception is thrown

        Parameters:
        buffer - An existing ByteBuffer
        Returns:
        The read string
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if the buffer end is reached before a string is read

      • readNetworkString

        public static java.lang.String readNetworkString​(java.io.InputStream is)
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 java.io.EOFException
        Attempts to read a network formated string from an InputStream (cf. Documentation for network string formatting)

        This method will blocks until a string could be read, or an exception is thrown

        Parameters:
        is - an InputStream
        Returns:
        The read string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the reading process threw an exception
        java.io.EOFException - if the end of the stream was reached unexpectedly

      • peekNetworkString

        public static java.lang.String peekNetworkString​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Attempts to read a network formated string from an InputStream at the current index and decrement the index by the number of byte read

        This method will blocks until a string could be read, or an exception is thrown

        Parameters:
        buffer - a ByteBuffer
        Returns:
        The peeked string
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if the buffer end is reached before a string could be read read

      • readInt

        public static int readInt​(java.io.InputStream is)
                   throws java.io.EOFException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Attempts to read an integer from the inputStream

        This method will blocks until an integer could be read, or an exception is thrown

        Parameters:
        is -
        Returns:
        The read integer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/O error occured
        java.io.EOFException - if fewer than 4 bytes could be read

      • hexDump

        public static void hexDump​(byte[] array)
        Prints a byte array in an hexdump fashion. Fancy !
        Parameters:
        array - an array of bytes
